intro: Luzama carmenensis, commonly known as the Carmenensis Luzama, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a host plant for certain insect species. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
